title: Leaverbuster
body: I always get a Leaverbuster because I am lagging out so much. I think it should be discontinued, even though there are trolls out there. The trolls do make us lose games a lot, but so do game crashes. If I got one dollar every time my laptop crashed, I would probably have about $10. Every time this has happened, I got a Leaverbuster. I do occasionally leave games, but that is quite rare. I do not think that the Leaverbuster program should be continued. Even if it isn't discontinued, I would still like it to not add up when the game crashes. If this was the case, I would only have one Leaverbuster, rather than the ten I have probably received before now. Trolls can be harmful to your game and make you sad, but so can a Leaverbuster which was earned by crashing and the game automatically closing. Any thoughts on this?

replies.body:
A faulty connection/computer causing disconnections consistently enough to cause LB is the fault of the player, as outlined in the TOU and EULA. This is ***YOUR OWN FAULT***. Riot aren't going to discontinue LB because you aren't keeping your agreement with them, nor do they care about your complaints on the matter.

>  I would still like it to not add up when the game crashes.

Well then, share with us you brilliant plan to help the system identify the difference between someone's connection being cut as the result as their computer crashing and someone just turning it off or disconnecting their modem. What's that? You don't have one? Thought as much.

> Faggot.

*Epic response mate. 11/10. I'll shut up now.*

"I'm breaking the rules and getting punished automatically, lets remove the automatic system so I don't get punished."
you're actually too fucking stupid. people like you are the reason we have leaverbuster.

I feel for you bro, the same thing ALWAYS happens to me, the leaving game because of crashes and getting leaverbusted because of it and even when i join games back half way through and even winning sometimes, i still get banned. This either needs fixing or to become discontinued.
